graph
Class HGraph

java.lang.Object
  graph.HGraph
public class HGraph
extends java.lang.Object

HGraph class represents hyper-graphs where each edge ("net" to be precise), connects two or more nodes together. The class is NOT thread-safe and none of its methods is properly synchronized for multi-threaded use.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Constructor Detail

HGraph

public HGraph(int numnodes,
              int numarcs)
public constructor specifying hyper-graph dimensions. Node labels are initialized to null. Nets have to be added via repeated calls to addHLink(nodeids, weight);.

Parameters:
numnodes - int number of nodes in the hyper-graph.
numarcs - int number of nets the hyper-graph has.

HGraph

public HGraph(int numnodes,
              int numarcs,
              java.lang.Object[] labels)
public constructor specifying hyper-graph dimensions as well as node labels. Nets have to be added via repeated calls to addHLink(nodeids, weight);.

Parameters:
numnodes - int number of nodes.
numarcs - int number of nets.
labels - Object[] an array of labels for each of the nodes of the hyper-graph. labels[i] is the label of node with id i.
Method Detail

addHLink

public void addHLink(java.util.Set nodeids,
                     double weight)
              throws GraphException
adds a net to this hyper-graph.

Parameters:
nodeids - Set // Set<Integer> the set of node-ids this net covers.
weight - double weight of the net.
Throws:
GraphException - if this hyper-graph already has the specified number of nets added to it.

setHNodeLabel

public void setHNodeLabel(int i,
                          java.lang.Object o)
set the label of the i-th node. Will replace any existing label for that node.

Parameters:
i - int the id of the node (in [0,num_nodes-1]).
o - Object the label for the i-th node.

getNumComponents

public int getNumComponents()
gets the number of components for this HGraph, computing them if they are not yet computed.

Returns:
int

getComponents

public int[] getComponents()
return all maximal connected components of this Graph. The array that is returned is of length _nodes.length and the i-th element has a value from [0...#Components-1] indicating to which component the node belongs.

Returns:
int[]

getComponentCard

public int getComponentCard(int i)
return the number of nodes in max connected component i, where i is in the range [0, #comps-1].

Parameters:
i - int
Returns:
int

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
return a String representation of this HGraph by specifying its number of nodes and nets, and then, the node ids for each of its nets.

Returns:
String
